description:
fmt: honor integer radix formats (%d etc.) for pointers
Before, pointers always appeared as 0x1234ABCD. This CL
keeps that as the default for %p and %v, but lets explicit
numeric verbs override the default.
Fixes issue 3936.

messages.text:

fmt: honor integer radix formats (%d etc.) for pointers
Before, pointers always appeared as 0x1234ABCD. This CL
keeps that as the default for %p and %v, but lets explicit
numeric verbs override the default.
Fixes issue 3936.
